author: tlsalex
body:
## Summary of the new feature/enhancement
I want to see the listening port and its program at the same time in windows.
But I only see the port , and the program name is not available in windows.
Bellow is the output from LINUX that implement similar feature.
I hope Get-NetTCPConnection have the same feature.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36788337/85349859-227f9400-b532-11ea-9eb2-78e442d6a11d.png)

A clear and concise description of what the problem is that the new feature would solve.
Try formulating it in user story style (if applicable):
'As a user I want X so that Y.' with X being the being the action and Y being the value of the action.
-->

## Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

-->

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Get-NetTCPConnection is not in the repository. Use UserVoice site to send your request to MSFT owner team.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: hcoona
comments.body: @iSazonov Where is the command `Get-NetTCPConnection` maintained? Is it available on Linux/macOS? What's the scope of the core functions/core utilities of PowerShell?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @hcoona The cmdlet is in NetTCPIP module. The module is Windows only.

title: ( Get-NetTCPConnection -State Listen ) vs (netstat -tlnp in linux)
